value.title: Analyze days from two months on one line chart in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you struggled to compare data from two different time periods in Power BI? Does the data just continue on and not overlap? Patrick shows you how you can easily overlay the data for comparison.  Download sample: https://guyinacu.be/twomonthssample  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Getting Started with Power BI Desktop in 5 steps

From downloading, to getting data, and then building your report visuals.  Getting started with Power BI Desktop https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/desktop-getting-started

value.title: How do you conditionally highlight a bar in a Power BI Report?
value.excerpt: There are different interactions Power BI visuals can have, but how do we conditionally highlight a bar in a Power BI report using a slicer? value.title: The Power BI Smart Narrative visual is INSANE AMAZING!
value.excerpt: The smart narrative visual can help tell the story in your Power BI report. Justyna Lucznik joins us to explore the visual and to illustrate how you can generate text about your data.  Make sure you have the September 2020 version of Power BI Desktop, or later.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/visuals/power-bi-visualization-smart-narrative

value.title: Computing rolling average in DAX
value.excerpt: Computing the rolling 12-months average in DAX looks simple, but it hides some level of complexity.  This article explains how to write the best formula and how to avoid common pitfalls using time intelligence functions. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15161?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt

value.title: Using the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how the SELECTEDVALUE DAX function simplifies the syntax required in many scenarios where you need to read a single value selected in the filter context.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/53917?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
